results.title: As Overdose Deaths Pile Up, a Medical Examiner Quits the Morgue
results.abstract: “It has completely overwhelmed us,” Dr. Thomas A. Andrew said of the opioid crisis. His new ambition: minister to the living about the dangers of drugs.

multimedia.caption: Dr. Thomas Andrew, the chief medical examiner of New Hampshire, retired last month. Bodies from overdose deaths have overwhelmed medical examiners across the country.

results.title: The Art of Thinking Well
results.abstract: How do you persuade people? It’s not always by presenting the facts.

multimedia.caption: Richard Thaler, left, won the Nobel Prize in economics on Monday in part because he realized people act irrationally.
Richard Thaler, left, won the Nobel Prize in economics on Monday in part because he realized people act irrationally.

results.title: Dove Drops an Ad Accused of Racism
results.abstract: In a Facebook ad for Dove body wash, a black woman removes her shirt to reveal a white woman. The company apologized, but similar ads by others have been common.

results.title: How to Explore a City Like a Local Using Your Smartphone
results.abstract: Three apps that make it easy to connect with locals — without having to talk to them in person.
